fields.headline: Friday quiz June 17 2005
fields.bodyText: 1) What's the connection between: Christian Bale; Michael Keaton; Adam West; Peter Ustinov (in relation to David Niven)? Answer: Batman: Bale stars as the caped crusader in Batman Begins, Keaton in Tim Burton's Batman and Batman Returns, West in the 1966 Batman. Private Peter Ustinov (co-screenwriter) served as star Captain David Niven's batman as a cover-up during the production of The Way Ahead in the second world war. 2) What do these four have in common: Leslie Howard; David Niven; Sidney James; and Richard E Grant? Answer: They have all played versions of Percy Blakeney/the Scarlet Pimpernel: Howard starred in The Scarlet Pimpernel (1934); Niven in The Elusive Pimpernel (1950); James as Sir Rodney Ffing/The Black Fingernail in Carry On ... Don't Lose Your Head; Grant starred in the TV series The Scarlet Pimpernel in 1999. 3) Who, aside from the obvious, is the odd one out of this quartet: Sid James; Richard E. Grant; Basil Rathbone; Charlize Theron? Answer: Grant was born in Swaziland, the other three were born in South Africa. 4) How, supposedly, did Leslie Howard inspire Stellan Skarsgård on the big screen and Richard Chamberlain on the small? Answer: Chamberlain, in the 1985 TV movie Wallenberg: A Hero's Story and Skarsgård in the 1990 Swedish film God Afton, Herr Wallenberg, both starred as Raoul Wallenberg, the Swedish diplomat who was reportedly inspired in his efforts to save the lives of thousands of Hungarian Jews in the Holocaust by seeing Howard's life-saving escapades in Pimpernel Smith. 5) How is Howard connected to the cannibalised bibliophile in The Cook, the Thief, His Wife and Her Lover? Answer: Alan Howard, who plays Michael in The Cook, the Thief... is Leslie Howard's nephew. 6) What is significant about the names of the four main characters in The Cook, the Thief...: Richard; Albert; Georgina; Michael? Answer: They are the first names of the actors that writer/director Peter Greenaway had in mind when developing the film: Richard Bohringer, who did indeed play the cook; Albert Finney to play the thief; Georgina Hale to play his wife, ultimately played by Helen Mirren; while Michael Gambon, who eventually starred as the thief, was Greenaway's original idea to play her lover. 7) In which film does Richard Bohringer reveal that his satori is "the Zen of buttering bread"? Answer: In Jean-Jacques Beineix's Diva, in which Bohringer stars as the mysterious Gorodish. 8) What connects: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Léos Carax and Luc Besson; Julie Christie and Donald Sutherland; Bruce Willis's voice; Lauren Bacall? Answer: Look: the visually flashy work of these directors was known as the "cin&eacutema du look"; Christie and Sutherland starred in Nic Roeg's Don't Look Now; Willis voiced the baby in Look Who's Talking; Bacall was nicknamed The Look. 9) What do Kirstie Alley, Juliette Lewis, John Travolta and Stephen Boyd have in common? Answer: They all are or were Scientologists. 10) What links Lewis and Lori Martin? Answers: They played the equivalent roles in the two versions of Cape Fear: Lewis playing Danielle Bowden in Martin Scorsese's 1991 remake and Martin starring as Nancy Bowden in J Lee Thompson's 1961 original.
